Aidan Baker.title: Acoustic​/​Variations On A Loop
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
Four tracks constructed from four short (40-60 second) loops made with a 12-string acoustic guitar played in various different ways, as indicated in the track titles, and then played back and live-processed using multiple delay pedals.
Released digitally by Hard Return, a label for repetitive / persistent music:
hardreturn.bandcamp.com
Other Aidan Baker releases in this 'Variations On A Loop' series can be found here:
bspdigitalreleases.bandcamp.com
Aidan Baker.credits:
released May 19, 2022

Aidan Baker.title: Already Drowning
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
An album of ethereal post-rock, something of a song-cycle, taking inspiration from various myths and folktales about female water spirits, with guest vocalists on each track. Released on CD & LP from Gizeh Records:
www.gizehrecords.com
Also available, a companion digital ep "Tout Juste Sous La Surface, Je Guette + Remixes" with mixes by Aidan Baker, A.R.C. Soundtracks, Schneider TM, & thisquietarmy:
aidanbaker.bandcamp.com/album/tout-juste-sous-la-surface-je-guette

Aidan Baker.title: An Instance of Rising / Liminoid
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
A limited CD release from Gizeh Records featuring two neo-classical pieces. "An Instance of RIsing" was commissioned by the Sacrum Profanum Festival in Krakow, Poland and performed on 30 September 2017 by Spółdzielnia Muzyczna Contemporary Ensemble.
"Liminoid," originally composed for 2008 performance at The Music Gallery in Toronto, Canada, was performed again at the Zemlika Festival in Durbe, Latvia on 28 October 2011 with members of the Sinfonietta Riga String Quartet + The Burning Kulba.
www.gizehrecords.com

Aidan Baker.title: Concretion
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
Three long tracks of experimental/ambient guitar and voice, originally released on cdr by DTA Records.
'T'was In The Moon of Wintertime' is also known as 'The Huron Carol'—or originally 'Jesous Ahatonhia' in the Wendat (Huron) language—and is purportedly Canada's oldest Christmas carol, and is not without controversy. Bruce Cockburn also recorded this carol and expressed, for anyone interested, some of his thoughts on that controversy here:
cockburnproject.net/songs&music/ia.html
Aidan Baker.credits:
released January 1, 2003
Aidan Baker - electric guitar, voice

Aidan Baker.title: The Spectrum of Distraction (Complete Sessions)
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
The complete, unedited sessions which made up the fragmentary, multi-genre, designed to be played on shuffle 2CD album "The Spectrum of Distraction" originally released by Robotic Empire:
aidanbaker.bandcamp.com/album/the-spectrum-of-distraction
With contributions from 18 different drummers:
Aidan Baker, Richard Baker (ARC), Victor Cirone, Andrew Crawshaw (Shining Ones), Alessandro Curvaia (Shora), Bruno Dorella (Ovo), David Dunnett (Hypnodrone Ensemble), Thor Harris (Swans), Steven Hess (Locrian), Kevin Micka (Animal Hospital), Mac McNeilly (Jesus Lizard), Ted Parsons (Swans, Prong), Phil Petrocelli (Grey Machine, Great Falls), Simon Scott (Slowdive), Geoff Summers (Batillus), Jakob Thiesen (Whisper Room), Brandon Valdivia (I Have Eaten The City), H. Walker (Kerretta).
Artwork by Matt Smith:
www.matt-illustrations.com
Aidan Baker.credits: released July 1, 2016

Aidan Baker.title: Triptychs: Variations On A Melody
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
Triptychs: Variations On A Melody takes inspiration from Erik Satie's compositions Gymnopédies and his notion of "furniture music," which many consider a precursor to contemporary ambient music. Each "triptych" is based around a simple, slow-moving melodic line, which repeats three times with the addition of a harmonic line upon each repetition, culminating in a three part harmony. Available on CD from Important Records.
www.importantrecords.com

released September 16, 2014
Aidan Baker - guitars, melodica

Aidan Baker.title: Laika World
Aidan Baker.artist: Aidan Baker | Jack Chuter | Ryan Durfee
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
LAIKA WORLD is a collaborative album by Aidan Baker, Jack Chuter, and Ryan Durfee, created in tribute to Laika, the Soviet space dog who became the first animal to orbit Earth aboard Sputnik 2 on November 3, 1957.
The album is a sonic blend of diverse influences, including Dean Hurley, SpaceGhostPurrp, Starflyer 59, Emeralds, Flying Saucer Attack, painter Morris Graves, and the films of Renee Harmon and Takeshi Kitano. Birdsong detonates from within sweeps of reverbed guitar, synthesiser and hypnagogic vocal spill, while frenetic drums keep an intermittent sense of time.
Ideal for those who enjoy late-night conversations and the vivid dreams that follow.
Limited cassette available from Cruel Nature Recordings:
cruelnaturerecordings.bandcamp.com/album/laika-world
Aidan Baker.credits:
released October 25, 2024
Aidan Baker - drums, percussion
Jack Chuter - guitar, voice, synth, samples
Ryan Durfee - field recordings, Korg WaveState, Koala

Aidan Baker.title: Thoughts of Trio
Aidan Baker.artist: Aidan Baker | Han-earl Park | Katharina Schmidt
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
Thoughts of Trio documents a live-in-studio performance by Canadian guitarist Aidan Baker, Korean-American guitarist Han-earl Park, & German drummer/percussionist Katharina Schmidt. The group brings together their respective, disparate musical backgrounds to explore the intersections of ambient music, improvisational (free) jazz, and musique-concrète.
Recorded at Morphine Raum in Berlin, Germany on February 21, 2024 by Rabih Beaini.
Released on CD by Attenuation Circuit and cassette by Cruel Nature Recordings:
emerge.bandcamp.com/album/thoughts-of-trio
cruelnaturerecordings.bandcamp.com/album/thoughts-of-trio

Aidan Baker.about:
First in a series of five Trio Not Trio CD releases from Gizeh Records, each album with a different trio line-up, recorded as a duo in person in Berlin and completed long-distance by a third, international musician.
This first album features American drummer John Colpitts (aka Kid Millions, also of Man Forever, Oneida) and British vocalist Stacy Taylor (aka Sarrf):
johncolpitts.bandcamp.com
www.sarff.net
www.gizehrecords.com
Aidan Baker.credits:
released May 9, 2023
Aidan Baker - guitar
Stacy Taylor - voice
John Colpitts - drums

Aidan Baker.title: Trio Not Trio - Yonbanme
Aidan Baker.artist: Aidan Baker, Tobias Humble, Ayami Suzuki
Aidan Baker.label: Broken Spine Productions
Aidan Baker.about:
Fourth in a series of five Trio Not Trio CD releases from Gizeh Records, each album with a different trio line-up, recorded as a duo in person in Berlin and completed long-distance by a third, international musician.
This fourth album features British drummer Tobias Humble (also of Lawns,Tricky, Mick Harvey, etc.) and Japanese vocalist/electronic musician Ayami Suzuki (aka Sand Fountain):
www.tobiashumble.com
www.ayamisuzuki.jp
www.gizehrecords.com
Aidan Baker.credits:
released September 22, 2023
Aidan Baker - guitar
Tobias Humble - drums
Ayami Suzuki - voice/electronics
